abstract: David O. Sacks, the chief executive of Yammer, who recently sold his business to Microsoft for $1.2 billion, is suddenly bearish on start-ups. On Saturday, he wrote on Facebook: “I think Silicon Valley as we know it may be coming to an end.”
snippet: David O. Sacks, the chief executive of Yammer, who recently sold his business to Microsoft for $1.2 billion, is suddenly bearish on start-ups. On Saturday, he wrote on Facebook: “I think Silicon Valley as we know it may be coming to an end.”
lead_paragraph: David O. Sacks, the chief executive of Yammer, who recently sold his business to Microsoft for $1.2 billion, is suddenly bearish on start-ups.

headline.main: After Microsoft Deal, Yammer Chief Issues Gloomy Forecast for Silicon Valley’s Start-Ups
